New Records: West Indies posted a record-breaking total on the board courtesy of a swash-buckling 98 from Nicholas Pooran.
Key Match Events: Obed McCoy took 3 wickets for 14 runs in 3 overs.
West Indies beat Afghanistan by 104 runs.
Akeal Hosein got an early breakthrough and set the tone for West Indies.
Obed McCoy picked up three wickets including two in the same over.
Andre Russell wrapped things up for the Windies.
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell, the victorious skipper of West Indies, expressed that it feels very good to finish unbeaten and appreciated the hard work put in by the team.
Rashid Khan, the captain of Afghanistan, mentioned that West Indies batted really well in the Powerplay and it is hard to come back when you concede 90 runs in the first six overs.
Nicholas Pooran, the PLAYER OF THE MATCH, reflected on his knock and the team's consistent performance over the last 13-14 months.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in St. Lucia, one of the best batting surfaces in the tournament.
The strong breeze was a factor in the game, affecting bowling strategies.
